{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3103563,"name":"blu28","username":"blu28","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/blu28/{size}/9433_2.png","created_at":"2022-11-25T14:57:16.385Z","cooked":"

In the WPI docs at docs.wpilib.org in the section on ShuffleBoard, there is an example of placing a widget to run a command. The call is the SmartDashboard.putData. Then there is an image of a set of commands that are grouped together. The text says “In the image below there are a number of commands contained in a Shuffleboard list.”, but there is no example code. The only example is using SmartDashboard. How do you get those commands into a ShuffleboardList?

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":10,"updated_at":"2022-11-25T14:57:16.385Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":79,"reads":91,"readers_count":90,"score":413.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":418636,"topic_slug":"grouping-commands-in-shuffleboard","display_username":"blu28","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"http://docs.wpilib.org","internal":false,"reflection":false,"clicks":8},{"url":"https://www.chiefdelphi.com/t/commandbase-subsystembase-depreciation/438975/21","internal":true,"reflection":true,"title":"CommandBase/SubsystemBase depreciation","clicks":0}],"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":10689,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/grouping-commands-in-shuffleboard/418636/1","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null,"can_vote":false},{"id":3103566,"name":"Peter Johnson","username":"Peter_Johnson","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/peter_johnson/{size}/10417_2.png","created_at":"2022-11-25T15:08:44.983Z","cooked":"

If you want to create it programmatically, create a ShuffleboardLayout in a tab with addLayout(), and then call ShuffleboardLayout.add() as many times as you want to add Sendables to the layout (and commands are Sendable).

https://github.wpilib.org/allwpilib/docs/release/java/edu/wpi/first/wpilibj/shuffleboard/ShuffleboardContainer.html#getLayout(java.lang.String)

Just a suggestion, but maybe the section of the docs on Shuffleboard should show how to put commands in the Shuffleboard using Shuffleboard methods. And provide the example code to go with the image.

Now I am having a problem adding a command to the Shuffleboard as you suggested.

I had this code:

sbCommandsTab = Shuffleboard.getTab(“Commands”);
…
public void logCommand(Command com) {
sbCommandsTab.add(com.getName(), com);
}

And a call in the command constructor:
logCommand(this);

I get a traceback:
Error at frc.robot.DataLogging.logCommand(DataLogging.java:156): Unhandled exception: java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: Cannot add data of type frc.robot.commands.ExampleCommand to Shuffleboard

I thought the problem was that there is an “add” method that takes a string and a sendable that returns a ComplexWidget, but also an “add” method that takes a string and an Object that returns a SimpleWidget, so I tried adding a cast of com to a Sendable, but that didn’t help.

","post_number":6,"post_type":1,"posts_count":10,"updated_at":"2022-11-25T15:44:31.857Z","reply_count":2,"reply_to_post_number":4,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":66,"readers_count":65,"score":28.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":418636,"topic_slug":"grouping-commands-in-shuffleboard","display_username":"blu28","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":13575,"username":"Peter_Johnson","name":"Peter Johnson","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/peter_johnson/{size}/10417_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":10689,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/grouping-commands-in-shuffleboard/418636/6","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3103582,"name":"Peter Johnson","username":"Peter_Johnson","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/peter_johnson/{size}/10417_2.png","created_at":"2022-11-25T16:01:46.190Z","cooked":"

Try taking a Sendable (or CommandBase) to logCommand() instead of Command. Command is not itself Sendable, but CommandBase is.

","post_number":7,"post_type":1,"posts_count":10,"updated_at":"2022-11-25T16:01:46.190Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":6,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":57,"readers_count":56,"score":16.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":418636,"topic_slug":"grouping-commands-in-shuffleboard","display_username":"Peter Johnson","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":10689,"username":"blu28","name":"blu28","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/blu28/{size}/9433_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":13575,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Volunteer WPILib Developer, CSA"},"post_url":"/t/grouping-commands-in-shuffleboard/418636/7","custom_user_title":"Volunteer WPILib Developer, CSA","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3103588,"name":"Ryan Blue","username":"Ryan_Blue","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/ryan_blue/{size}/174016_2.png","created_at":"2022-11-25T16:20:54.444Z","cooked":"

In your command class are you extending Command or CommandBase? Command does not implement Sendable (and therefore can’t be casted to do so), while CommandBase does

","post_number":8,"post_type":1,"posts_count":10,"updated_at":"2022-11-25T16:20:54.444Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":6,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":55,"readers_count":54,"score":16.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":418636,"topic_slug":"grouping-commands-in-shuffleboard","display_username":"Ryan Blue","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":10689,"username":"blu28","name":"blu28","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/blu28/{size}/9433_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":29846,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"WPILib Dev | 1024 Mentor"},"post_url":"/t/grouping-commands-in-shuffleboard/418636/8","custom_user_title":"WPILib Dev | 1024 Mentor","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3103589,"name":"Eli Barnett","username":"Oblarg","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/oblarg/{size}/161674_2.png","created_at":"2022-11-25T16:26:47.579Z","cooked":"

More reason to just delete the interface and move all the defaulted methods into CommandBase (which should be renamed Command)…

This would break everyone’s code, but in a very easily-fixed way. The fact that there’s an interface that’s separate from the abstract class at all is a java-ism that should probably have never happened.
